MutationEvent.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The MutationEvent interface provides event properties that are specific to modifications to the Document Object Model (DOM) hierarchy and nodes.

blockquote.para: They have been deprecated in favor of mutation observers. Consider using these instead.

MutationEventInitMutationEvent.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The initMutationEvent() method of the interface initializes the
value of a mutation event once it's been created (normally using the method).

remarks.para: This method must be called to set the event before it is dispatched, using .

blockquote.para: In general, you won't create these events yourself; they are created by the browser.

MutationEventAttrChange.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The attrChange read-only property of the interface returns a number indicating what kind of change triggered the DOMAttrModified event. The three possible values are MODIFICATION (1), ADDITION (2) or REMOVAL (3). It has no meaning for other events and is then set to 0.

MutationEventAttrName.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The attrName read-only property of the interface returns a string with the name of the node affected by the DOMAttrModified event. It has no meaning for other events and is then set to the empty string ("").

MutationEventPrevValue.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The prevValue read-only property of the interface returns a string. In DOMAttrModified events, it represents the previous value of the node. In DOMCharacterDataModified events, it contains the previous value of the node. In all other cases, returns the empty string ("").

MutationEventRelatedNode.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The relatedNode read-only property of the interface returns a string indicating the node related to the event, like the changed node inside the subtree for DOMSubtreeModified.

MutationEventNewValue.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The newValue read-only property of the interface returns a string. In DOMAttrModified events, it represents the new value of the node. In DOMCharacterDataModified events, it contains the new value of the node. In all other cases, returns the empty string ("").
